page.title: 09THE PUB AT RODINGTON
page.content: WHEN THE PUB IS CLOSED THERE IS STILL A LOT OF WORK FOR THE LANDLORD TO DO. STOCK HAS TO BE ORDERED AND SHELVES HAVE TO BE RESTOCKED. THE PIPES AND THE CELLARS HAVE TO BE CLEANED. THEY KEEP DRAUGHT BEER SO THE BARRELS HAVE TO BE PEGGED. THE CELLARS MUST BE KEPT AT A CONSTANT TEMPERATURE OF BETWEEN 10 AND 15 DEGREES CENTIGRADE OR THE BEER WILL SPOIL. A CLEANER COMES IN FOR 2\HOURS EVERY DAY TO CLEAN THE REST OF THE PUB. THEY ALSO EMPLOY PEOPLE TO WORK BEHIND THE BAR SERVING DRINKS AND IN THE KITCHEN COOKING AND SERVING MEALS. Â£115 WORTH OF MEAT AND Â£150 WORTH OF FROZEN FOOD IS BOUGHT EVERY WEEK. THEY SERVE 190 POUNDS WEIGHT OF CHIPS EVERY WEEK. THEY ALSO CATER FOR PARTIES. THEY KEEP BEER - MILD, BITTER, STOUT, AND LAGER, WINE SHERRY AND LEMONADE ON TAP AND MANY BOTTLED DRINKS.
